title: The JSON Schema for the NIST Extended Resource Data model (NERDm)
description: A JSON Schema specfying the core NERDm classes
These classes extend the based NERDm schema to different types of published data

types.name: Resource
description: a resource (e.g. data collection, service, website or tool) that can participate in a data-driven application.

There are different types of Resources; this Named Type represents a generic resource. The other Resource types described later in this section add additional metadata to the base set shown here to describe more specific kinds of resources (like data publications, APIs, etc.)
types.brief: a resource (e.g. data collection, service, website or tool) that can participate in a data-driven application

properties.name: title
description: Human-readable, descriptive name of the resource
properties.brief: Human-readable, descriptive name of the resource
properties.label: Title
schema_notes: Acronyms should be avoided
examples: "The NIST High Temperature Superconducting Materials Database"

properties.name: description
description: Human-readable description (e.g., an abstract) of the resource
properties.brief: Human-readable description (e.g., an abstract) of the resource
properties.label: Description
schema_notes: Each element in the array should be considered a separate paragraph
notes: Each list element should be considered as a separate paragraph.

properties.name: keyword
description: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.
properties.brief: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.
properties.label: Tags
schema_notes: Surround each keyword with quotes. Separate keywords with commas. Avoid duplicate keywords in the same record.
notes: Each value in the list represents a different keyword.  Keywords can be made up of multiple words

properties.name: topic
description: A tag or label taken from a pre-defined vocabulary for a thing or concept that this resource addresses or speaks to
properties.brief: A tag or label taken from a pre-defined vocabulary for a thing or concept that this resource addresses or speaks to
properties.label: topic

properties.name: modified
description: Most recent date on which the dataset was changed, updated or modified.
properties.brief: Most recent date on which the dataset was changed, updated or modified.
properties.label: modified
schema_notes: Dates should be ISO 8601 of highest resolution. In other words, as much of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD as is relevant to this dataset. If there is a need to reflect that the dataset is continually updated, ISO 8601 formatting can account for this with repeating intervals. For instance, R/P1D for daily, R/P2W for every two weeks, and R/PT5M for every five minutes.
notes: The value is usually a single formated date, like 2017-04-21, or a data and time, like 2019-02-23T14:31:10.3
A special format is used to indicate the resource is regularly update; e.g., R/P1W (for once a week); see ISO8601DateRange for details.

properties.name: issued
description: Date of formal issuance of the resource
properties.brief: Date of formal issuance of the resource
properties.label: Release Date
notes: The value is usually a single formated date, like 2017-04-21

properties.name: publisher
description: The publishing entity and optionally their parent organization(s).
properties.brief: The publishing entity and optionally their parent organization(s).
properties.label: publisher
schema_notes: This is a container for a publisher object which groups together the fields: name and subOrganization. The subOrganization field can also contain a publisher object which allows one to describe an organization's hierarchy. Where greater specificity is desired, include as many levels of publisher as is useful, in ascending order, using the below format.

properties.name: contactPoint
description: Contact information for getting more information about this resource
properties.brief: Contact information for getting more information about this resource
properties.label: contactPoint
schema_notes: This should include at least a name and an email address
The information can reflect either a person or a group (such as a help desk)

properties.name: accessLevel
description: The degree to which this dataset could be made publicly-available, regardless of whether it has been made available
properties.brief: The degree to which this dataset is publicly-available (or is restricted in some way)
properties.label: Public Access Level

allowed.public: Data asset is or could be made publicly available to all without restrictions
allowed.restricted public: Data asset is available under certain use restrictions
allowed.non-public: Data asset is not available to members of the public

properties.name: license
description: A pointer to the primary license or non-license (i.e. Public Domain) statement with which the dataset or API has been published
properties.brief: A pointer to the primary license or non-license (i.e. Public Domain) statement with which the dataset or API has been published
properties.label: License
schema_notes: Software and data developed primarily by federal employees must be considered in the public domain; software primarily developed by contract can be assigned a license, including an open source license.
By default, NIST-produced data and software should point to http://www.nist.gov/data/license.cfm
See Open Licenses (https://project-open-data.cio.gov/open-licenses/) for more information.

properties.name: rights
description: information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies
properties.brief: information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies
properties.label: Rights
schema_notes: This should also provide an explanation for the selected "accessLevel" including instructions for how to access a restricted file, if applicable, or explanation for why a "non-public" or "restricted public" data assetis not "public," if applicable.
Text must be 255 or fewer characters.

properties.name: components
description: a listing of the various component resources, tools, and distributions of this resource.  A component usually represents data that is part of this resource that be retrieved or a way to interact with the data.
properties.brief: a listing of the various component resources, tools, and distributions of this resource
properties.label: components
schema_notes: Records for the resources referenced in this list should specify this resource in its isPartOf field.
The @type property will indicate which type of component it is.  The first value in the @type list should be considered the primary or most important classification.
If an item's @type includes dcat:Distribution, the item should be convertable to a distribution in the POD schema.

The order should be considered meaningful (at least for components of the same type).  The meaning or intention behind the order can depend on the type; however, generally, display of the components of a common type should preserve the order.  For clarity then, it is recommended that items of the same primary type should be grouped together in the list.
notes: This list often includes the list of data files (represented as DataFile components) that are available to download.

Data files can be organized into a hierarchy of subcollections (like file folders). When this is the case, this list will also include Subcollection components. Both DataFile and Subcollection components included a filepath that indicates where it is located in the hierarchy.

properties.name: conformsTo
description: URI used to identify a standardized specification the resource conforms to
properties.brief: URI used to identify a standardized specification the resource conforms to
properties.label: Standard
notes: This identifier might refer to a file or dataset format, to database schema, or to a web API.

properties.name: isPartOf
description: The collection of which the dataset is a subset
properties.brief: The collection of which the dataset is a subset
properties.label: Collection
notes: The resource being referenced normally is one that is also described by a NERDm record which is accessible via its identifier (given in the proxyFor property).

properties.name: language
description: The primary language used in the dataset
properties.brief: The primary language used in the dataset
properties.label: Language

properties.name: landingPage
description: a URL to a human-friendly web page that represents the home or gateway to the resources that are part of this dataset.  This page represents the definitive location for accessing the resource.
properties.brief: a URL to a human-friendly web page for accessing the resource.
properties.label: Homepage URL

properties.name: references
description: Related documents such as literature articles, technical reports about a dataset, developer documentation, etc. that refer to or describe this resource
properties.brief: Other documents describing or relating to this resource
properties.label: Related Documents

properties.name: theme
description: Main thematic category of the dataset.
properties.brief: Main thematic category of the dataset.
properties.label: Category
schema_notes: Could include ISO Topic Categories (http://www.isotopicmaps.org/)
notes: Values are taken from the Taxonomy of NIST Research Areas.

properties.name: @id
description: The NIST-assigned unique identifier for the resource
properties.brief: The NIST-assigned identifier for the resource
properties.label: @id
schema_notes: It is expected that this field will contain a type of identifier that is of a uniform type across all resource descriptions in the system
This identifier should, by default, resolve to the metadata record (or some rendering of it) rather than to the resource itself (e.g. via its landing page).
notes: This identifier takes a the form of a NIST-issued ARK identifier (and thus starts with ark:/88434/)
If the resource has been assigned a DOI, it will appear in the doi

properties.name: doi
description: A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) in non-resolving form.
properties.brief: The Digital Object Identifier (DOI)
properties.label: doi
schema_notes: The DOI value should not have the resolver URI base, but should have the form 'doi:NNNNN/XXXXXX'
It is expected that this will primarily be Datacite DOIs

properties.name: ediid
description: the NIST EDI identifier assigned to the resource.  This is the identifier assigned by the MIDAS system.
properties.brief: the NIST EDI identifier assigned to the resource
properties.label: ediid

properties.name: abbrev
description: An abbreviated form of the resource's title.  This abbreviation can be used as a compact, human-readable reference to the resource.
properties.brief: an abbreviated form of the resource's title
properties.label: abbrev
schema_notes: this can be used as a label for a compact display or text for a link to this resource

properties.name: @type
description: The linked-data class types for this resource.  The labels given in this list indicate the kind of thing is being described by metadata.
properties.brief: the linked-data class types for this resource
properties.label: @type
schema_notes: The value must always be given as an array, even when only one type is provided.
Multiple values indicate that the Resource can be considered of multiple types
If this resource is not to be considered a subtype of the nrd:Resource, its value should be 'nrd:Resource'.
notes: This property is a list because it is possible for a resource to be catorgorized as multiple types simultaneously
The first value in the list will be the most specific resource type that applies to the resource and should be considered, therefore, its primary type.
Often, the values refer to Named Types defined explicitly in the NERDm schema (e.g. DataPublication); in this case, the resource metadata can include the extended metadata properties for that type.
Some values are just semantic labels that do not imply the existance of additional extended metadata.
These values are intended to be compliant with use of @type property in the JSON-LD format.

use.template: as the basis for extension type, {type}

types.name: DocumentReference
description: descriptive reference to a document
types.brief: descriptive reference to a document

properties.name: @id
description: a (relative) identifier for the reference
properties.brief: a (relative) identifier for the reference
properties.label: @id
schema_notes: This identifier refers specifically to the reference within a resource; it does not refer to document itself (which preferably has its own DOI).
Though not required by this schema, providing an identifier for a component is critical for merging information from different sources.
A relative identifier requires that @base be set to the Resource identifier in the @context.

properties.name: location
description: the URL for accessing the document
properties.brief: the URL for accessing the document
properties.label: location
schema_notes: It is assumed that the document can be viewed via a web browser (e.g. HTML, PDF, etc.)

properties.name: label
description: a recommended label or title to display as the text for a link to the document
properties.brief: a recommended label or title to display as the text for a link to the document
properties.label: label
schema_notes: This is intended to be briefer than a citation.

properties.name: citation
description: a full formated citation string for the reference, appropriate for inclusion in a bibliography
properties.brief: a full formated citation string for the reference, appropriate for inclusion in a bibliography
properties.label: citation

properties.name: refid
description: An persistent ID for the referenced document.
properties.brief: An persistent ID for the referenced document.
properties.label: refid
schema_notes: The ID should be given in a form (e.g. with a scheme prefix) such that its type is obvious.  Use 'doi:' for Cross-ref or Datacite IDs.
location may use the URL form of the ID.

properties.name: refType
description: the type of relationship that this document has with the resource
properties.brief: the type of relationship that this document has with the resource
properties.label: refType
schema_notes: This is equivalent to the Datacite relationType in that the term is a predicate that connects the resource as the subject to the referenced document as the object (e.g. resource IsDocumentedBy referenced-doc)
The DCiteDocumentReference type sets DataCite terms as controlled vocabulary

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} list property of the {type} type
as the basis for extension type, {type}

types.name: DCiteDocumentReference
description: a descriptive reference to a document with a controlled vocabulary for its reference type (refType)
types.brief: a descriptive reference to a document with a controlled vocabulary for its reference type (refType)

allowed.IsDocumentedBy: The referenced document provides documentation of the resource.
allowed.IsSupplementedBy: The referenced document is a supplement to the resource.
allowed.IsCitedBy: The referenced document cites the resource in some way.
allowed.Cites: This resource cites the referenced document.
allowed.IsReviewedBy: The referenced document reviews this resource.
allowed.IsReferencedBy: The resource is used as a source of information by the referenced document.
allowed.References: The referenced document is used as a source of information by the resource.
allowed.IsSourceOf: The resource is the source of upon which the referenced document is based.
allowed.IsDerivedFrom: The referenced document is the source upon which the resource is based.

use.template: as an allowed value type in the {prop} property in the {type} type

properties.name: @id
description: a (relative) identifier for the reference
properties.brief: a (relative) identifier for the reference
properties.label: @id
schema_notes: This identifier refers specifically to the reference within a resource; it does not refer to document itself (which preferably has its own DOI).
Though not required by this schema, providing an identifier for a component is critical for merging information from different sources.
A relative identifier requires that @base be set to the Resource identifier in the @context.

properties.name: location
description: the URL for accessing the document
properties.brief: the URL for accessing the document
properties.label: location
schema_notes: It is assumed that the document can be viewed via a web browser (e.g. HTML, PDF, etc.)

properties.name: label
description: a recommended label or title to display as the text for a link to the document
properties.brief: a recommended label or title to display as the text for a link to the document
properties.label: label
schema_notes: This is intended to be briefer than a citation.

properties.name: citation
description: a full formated citation string for the reference, appropriate for inclusion in a bibliography
properties.brief: a full formated citation string for the reference, appropriate for inclusion in a bibliography
properties.label: citation

properties.name: refid
description: An persistent ID for the referenced document.
properties.brief: An persistent ID for the referenced document.
properties.label: refid
schema_notes: The ID should be given in a form (e.g. with a scheme prefix) such that its type is obvious.  Use 'doi:' for Cross-ref or Datacite IDs.
location may use the URL form of the ID.

properties.name: refType
description: the type of relationship that this document has with the resource
properties.brief: the type of relationship that this document has with the resource
properties.label: refType
schema_notes: This is equivalent to the Datacite relationType in that the term is a predicate that connects the resource as the subject to the referenced document as the object (e.g. resource IsDocumentedBy referenced-doc)
The DCiteDocumentReference type sets DataCite terms as controlled vocabulary

types.name: ResourceReference
description: a reference to another resource that may have an associated ID
types.brief: a reference to another resource that may have an associated ID

properties.name: title
description: the name of the resource being referenced
properties.brief: the name of the resource being referenced
properties.label: title
schema_notes: This value is intended for display.
This can be, but is not required to be, the same title given in the metadata record describing the resource

properties.name: proxyFor
description: a local identifier representing this resource
properties.brief: a local identifier representing this resource
properties.label: proxyFor
schema_notes: This identifier is expected to point to an up-to-date description of the resource as known to the local system.  The properties associated with that identifier may be different those given in the current record.

properties.name: resourceType
description: the linked-data class types for the referenced resource
properties.brief: the linked-data class types for the referenced resource
properties.label: resourceType
schema_notes: The value must always be given as an array, even when only one type is provided.
Multiple values indicate that the Resource can be considered of multiple types; it is recommended that the primary type (usually the most specific) should be given first.
If this resource is not to be considered a subtype of the nrd:Resource, its value should be 'nrd:Resource'.

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type
as the basis for extension type, {type}
as a value type for the {prop} list property of the {type} type

types.name: Component
description: A description of one component of a resource.  A component can be a downloadable file, a subcollection of files, an API, or search page.
This Named Type represents a generic component; other Component types described later in this section represent specific kinds of components.
types.brief: a component of a resource

properties.name: @id
description: a relative identifier for the distribution It can be appended to its resource identifier to get a globally unique version of the identifier.
properties.brief: a relative identifier for the component.
properties.label: @id
schema_notes: Though not required by this schema, providing an identifier for a component is critical for merging information from different sources.
A relative identifier requires that @base be set to the Resource identifier in the @context.

properties.name: @type
description: the types of components that this component can be classified as
properties.brief: the types of components that this component can be classified as
properties.label: @type
schema_notes: the first value should be considered its primary type.  This is usually a subtype of Component.
notes: This property is a list because it is possible for a component to be catorgorized as multiple types simultaneously
An included value of nrd:Hidden indicates that the component is part of the NIST-internal management of the resource and is not expected to be useful to external users
These values are intended to be compliant with use of @type property in the JSON-LD format.

properties.name: title
description: a descriptive title for the component
properties.brief: a descriptive title for the component
properties.label: title

properties.name: description
description: a description of the nature and contents of the component, including the role it plays as part of the resource
properties.brief: a description of the nature and contents of the component, including the role it plays as part of the resource
properties.label: description

properties.name: topic
description: A tag or label taken from a pre-defined vocabulary for a thing or concept that this component addresses or speaks to
properties.brief: A tag or label taken from a pre-defined vocabulary for a thing or concept that this component addresses or speaks to
properties.label: topic

properties.name: conformsTo
description: URI used to identify a standardized specification the component conforms to
properties.brief: URI used to identify a standardized specification the component conforms to
properties.label: Standard

as the basis for extension type, {type}

types.name: IncludedResource
description: A reference to another resource (which has its own record) that is a part of this resource
types.brief: A reference to another resource (which has its own record) that is a part of this resource

use.template: as an allowed value type in the {prop} property in the {type} type
as an allowed value type in the {prop} property in the {type} type

inheritedProperties.brief: a description of a component of a resource

description: a (relative) identifier for the distribution
properties.brief: a (relative) identifier for the distribution
properties.label: @id

A relative identifier requires that @base be set to the Resource identifier in the @context.

properties.name: @type
description: the types of components that this component can be classified as
properties.brief: the types of components that this component can be classified as
properties.label: @type
schema_notes: the first value should be considered its primary type.  This is usually a subtype of Component.

properties.name: title
description: a descriptive title for the component
properties.brief: a descriptive title for the component
properties.label: title

properties.name: description
description: a description of the nature and contents of the component, including the role it plays as part of the resource
properties.brief: a description of the nature and contents of the component, including the role it plays as part of the resource
properties.label: description

properties.name: topic
description: Identified tags referring to things or concepts that this component addresses or speaks to
properties.brief: Identified tags referring to things or concepts that this component addresses or speaks to
properties.label: topic

properties.name: conformsTo
description: URI used to identify a standardized specification the component conforms to
properties.brief: URI used to identify a standardized specification the component conforms to
properties.label: Standard

inheritedProperties.brief: a reference to another resource that may have an associated ID

properties.name: title
description: the name of the resource being referenced
properties.brief: the name of the resource being referenced
properties.label: title
schema_notes: This value is intended for display.
This can be, but is not required to be, the same title given in the metadata record describing the resource

properties.name: proxyFor
description: a local identifier representing this resource
properties.brief: a local identifier representing this resource
properties.label: proxyFor
schema_notes: This identifier is expected to point to an up-to-date description of the resource as known to the local system.  The properties associated with that identifier may be different those given in the current record.

properties.name: resourceType
description: the linked-data class types for the referenced resource
properties.brief: the linked-data class types for the referenced resource
properties.label: resourceType
schema_notes: The value must always be given as an array, even when only one type is provided.
Multiple values indicate that the Resource can be considered of multiple types; it is recommended that the primary type (usually the most specific) should be given first.
If this resource is not to be considered a subtype of the nrd:Resource, its value should be 'nrd:Resource'.

types.name: ISO8601DateRange
description: a single date-time, a date range, or a periodic time interval compliant with the ISO 8601 standard for date-times and intervals

The format of the value is restricted to 3 forms. A single date has the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD, as in "2017-03-24T03:45:33.1"; note that any lowere precision version of this form is acceptable, such as "2017-03-24" or "2017".
A date range is expressed with two single dates in the above form separated by a forward slash (/)--as, in "2016-01/2016-12"

The third form from indicates a periodic interval, used to indicate that a resource is updated on a regular basis. Examples include "R/P1D" for daily, "R5/P2W" for 5 times, every 2 weeks. Consult the ISO 8601 standard for the detailed syntax.
types.brief: a single date-time, date-time range, or a periodic time interval

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type

types.name: Topic
description: a container for an identified concept term or proper thing
types.brief: a container for an identified concept term or proper thing

properties.name: @type
description: a label indicating whether the value refers to a concept or a thing
properties.brief: a label indicating whether the value refers to a concept or a thing
properties.label: @type

allowed.Concept: label indicating that the value refers to a concept (as in owl:Concept)
allowed.Thing: label indicating that the value refers to a named person, place, or thing (as in skos:Thing)

properties.name: scheme
description: a URI that identifies the controlled vocabulary, registry, or identifier system that the value is defined in.
properties.brief: a URI that identifies the controlled vocabulary, registry, or identifier system that the value is defined in.
properties.label: scheme

properties.name: @id
description: the unique identifier identifying the concept or thing
properties.brief: the unique identifier identifying the concept or thing
properties.label: @id

properties.name: tag
description: a short, display-able token that locally represents the concept or thing
properties.brief: a short, display-able token that locally represents the concept or thing
properties.label: tag
schema_notes: As a token, it is intended that applications can search for this value and find all resources that are talking about the same thing.  Thus, regardless of whether the @id field is provided, all references to the same concept or thing should use the same tag value.

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} list property of the {type} type
as a value type for the {prop} list property of the {type} type
as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type

types.name: Organization
description: a named organization that may be part of a larger organization
types.brief: a named organization that may be part of a larger organization

properties.name: @type
description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be org:Organization for each publisher
properties.brief: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be org:Organization for each publisher
properties.label: Metadata Context

properties.name: name
description: The plain-text name of the organization
properties.brief: The plain-text name of the organization
properties.label: Publisher Name

properties.name: subOrganizationOf
description: A parent organizational entity
properties.brief: A parent organizational entity
properties.label: subOrganizationOf

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type
as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type

types.name: ContactInfo
description: Information describing various ways to contact an entity
types.brief: Information describing various ways to contact an entity

properties.name: fn
description: full name of the contact person, role, or organization
properties.brief: full name of the contact person, role, or organization
properties.label: Contact Name

properties.name: hasEmail
description: The email address of the resource contact
properties.brief: The email address of the resource contact
properties.label: Email

properties.name: postalAddress
description: the contact mailing address
properties.brief: the contact mailing address
properties.label: postalAddress

properties.name: phoneNumber
description: the contact telephone number
properties.brief: the contact telephone number
properties.label: phoneNumber
schema_notes: Complete international dialing codes should be given, e.g. '+1-410-338-1234'

properties.name: timezone
description: the time zone where the contact typically operates
properties.brief: the time zone where the contact typically operates
properties.label: timezone

properties.name: proxyFor
description: a local identifier representing this person
properties.brief: a local identifier representing this person
properties.label: proxyFor
schema_notes: This identifier is expected to point to an up-to-date description of the person as known to the local system.  The properties associated with that identifier may be different those given in the current record.

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type

types.name: PostalAddress
description: a line-delimited listing of a postal address
types.brief: a line-delimited listing of a postal address

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type

types.name: Identifier
description: a complete description of an identifier, including the scheme that it adheres to
types.brief: a complete description of an identifier, including the scheme that it adheres to

properties.name: scheme
description: a label indicating the system that the identifier adheres to
properties.brief: a label indicating the system that the identifier adheres to
properties.label: scheme
schema_notes: this label may imply a particular resolver to use

properties.name: value
description: the value of the identifier
properties.brief: the value of the identifier
properties.label: value
schema_notes: if no scheme is provided, a URI form of the identifier should be given

types.name: PublicDataResource
description: a resource that can/should have a record in NIST's public data listing (PDL)
types.brief: a resource that can/should have a record in NIST's public data listing (PDL)

properties.name: accrualPeriodicity
description: Frequency with which dataset is published.
properties.brief: Frequency with which dataset is published.
properties.label: Frequency

properties.name: bureauCode
description: an identifier provided by the OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C that identifies the originating federal agency
properties.brief: an identifier provided by the OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C that identifies the originating federal agency
properties.label: Bureau Code
schema_notes: OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C is available via http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/omb/assets/a11_current_year/app_c.pdf
A machine-readable listing of the defined codes is available via https://project-open-data.cio.gov/data/omb_bureau_codes.csv
Codes have the format of 015:01

properties.name: programCode
description: an identifier provided by the Federal Program Inventory that identifies the primary program related to this data asset
properties.brief: an identifier provided by the Federal Program Inventory that identifies the primary program related to this data asset
properties.label: Program Code
schema_notes: A machine-readable listing of the defined codes is available via https://www.performance.gov/sites/default/files/files/FederalProgramInventory_FY13_MachineReadable_091613.xls
Codes have the format of 015:001

properties.name: dataQuality
description: Whether the dataset meets the agency's Information Quality Guidelines
properties.brief: Whether the dataset meets the agency's Information Quality Guidelines
properties.label: Data Quality

properties.name: primaryITInvestmentUII
description: The IT Unique Investment Identifier (UII) that is associated with this dataset
properties.brief: The IT Unique Investment Identifier (UII) that is associated with this dataset
properties.label: Primary IT Investment UII

properties.name: systemOfRecords
description: The URL to the System of Records Notice related to this dataset if is so designated under the Privacy Act of 1974
properties.brief: The URL to the System of Records Notice related to this dataset if is so designated under the Privacy Act of 1974
properties.label: System of Records

use.template: as the basis for extension type, {type}

inheritedProperties.brief: a resource (e.g. data collection, service, website or tool) that can participate in a data-driven application

properties.name: title
description: Human-readable, descriptive name of the resource
properties.brief: Human-readable, descriptive name of the resource
properties.label: Title
schema_notes: Acronyms should be avoided

properties.name: description
description: Human-readable description (e.g., an abstract) of the resource
properties.brief: Human-readable description (e.g., an abstract) of the resource
properties.label: Description
schema_notes: Each element in the array should be considered a separate paragraph

properties.name: keyword
description: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.
properties.brief: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.
properties.label: Tags
schema_notes: Surround each keyword with quotes. Separate keywords with commas. Avoid duplicate keywords in the same record.

properties.name: topic
description: Identified tags referring to things or concepts that this resource addresses or speaks to
properties.brief: Identified tags referring to things or concepts that this resource addresses or speaks to
properties.label: topic

properties.name: modified
description: Most recent date on which the dataset was changed, updated or modified.
properties.brief: Most recent date on which the dataset was changed, updated or modified.
properties.label: modified
schema_notes: Dates should be ISO 8601 of highest resolution. In other words, as much of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD as is relevant to this dataset. If there is a need to reflect that the dataset is continually updated, ISO 8601 formatting can account for this with repeating intervals. For instance, R/P1D for daily, R/P2W for every two weeks, and R/PT5M for every five minutes.

properties.name: issued
description: Date of formal issuance of the resource
properties.brief: Date of formal issuance of the resource
properties.label: Release Date

properties.name: publisher
description: The publishing entity and optionally their parent organization(s).
properties.brief: The publishing entity and optionally their parent organization(s).
properties.label: publisher
schema_notes: This is a container for a publisher object which groups together the fields: name and subOrganization. The subOrganization field can also contain a publisher object which allows one to describe an organization's hierarchy. Where greater specificity is desired, include as many levels of publisher as is useful, in ascending order, using the below format.

properties.name: contactPoint
description: Contact information for getting more information about this resource
properties.brief: Contact information for getting more information about this resource
properties.label: contactPoint
schema_notes: This should include at least a name and an email address
The information can reflect either a person or a group (such as a help desk)

properties.name: accessLevel
description: The degree to which this dataset could be made publicly-available, regardless of whether it has been made available
properties.brief: The degree to which this dataset could be made publicly-available, regardless of whether it has been made available
properties.label: Public Access Level

allowed.public: Data asset is or could be made publicly available to all without restrictions
allowed.restricted public: Data asset is available under certain use restrictions
allowed.non-public: Data asset is not available to members of the public

properties.name: license
description: A pointer to the primary license or non-license (i.e. Public Domain) statement with which the dataset or API has been published
properties.brief: A pointer to the primary license or non-license (i.e. Public Domain) statement with which the dataset or API has been published
properties.label: License
schema_notes: Software and data developed primarily by federal employees must be considered in the public domain; software primarily developed by contract can be assigned a license, including an open source license.
By default, NIST-produced data and software should point to http://www.nist.gov/data/license.cfm
See Open Licenses (https://project-open-data.cio.gov/open-licenses/) for more information.

properties.name: rights
description: information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies
properties.brief: information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies
properties.label: Rights
schema_notes: This should also provide an explanation for the selected "accessLevel" including instructions for how to access a restricted file, if applicable, or explanation for why a "non-public" or "restricted public" data assetis not "public," if applicable.
Text must be 255 or fewer characters.

properties.name: components
description: a listing of the various component resources, tools, and distributions of this resource
properties.brief: a listing of the various component resources, tools, and distributions of this resource
properties.label: components
schema_notes: Records for the resources referenced in this list should specify this resource in its isPartOf field.
The @type property will indicate which type of component it is.  The first value in the @type list should be considered the primary or most important classification.
If an item's @type includes dcat:Distribution, the item should be convertable to a distribution in the POD schema.

The order should be considered meaningful (at least for components of the same type).  The meaning or intention behind the order can depend on the type; however, generally, display of the components of a common type should preserve the order.  For clarity then, it is recommended that items of the same primary type should be grouped together in the list.

properties.name: conformsTo
description: URI used to identify a standardized specification the resource conforms to
properties.brief: URI used to identify a standardized specification the resource conforms to
properties.label: Standard

properties.name: isPartOf
description: The collection of which the dataset is a subset
properties.brief: The collection of which the dataset is a subset
properties.label: Collection

properties.name: language
description: The primary language used in the dataset
properties.brief: The primary language used in the dataset
properties.label: Language

properties.name: landingPage
description: a URL to a human-friendly web page that represents the home or gateway to the resources that are part of this dataset.
properties.brief: a URL to a human-friendly web page that represents the home or gateway to the resources that are part of this dataset.
properties.label: Homepage URL

properties.name: references
description: Related documents such as technical information about a dataset, developer documentation, etc.
properties.brief: Related documents such as technical information about a dataset, developer documentation, etc.
properties.label: Related Documents

properties.name: theme
description: Main thematic category of the dataset.
properties.brief: Main thematic category of the dataset.
properties.label: Category
schema_notes: Could include ISO Topic Categories (http://www.isotopicmaps.org/)

properties.name: @id
description: A (primary) unique identifier for the resource
properties.brief: A (primary) unique identifier for the resource
properties.label: @id
schema_notes: It is expected that this field will contain a type of identifier that is of a uniform type across all resource descriptions in the system
This identifier should, by default, resolve to the metadata record (or some rendering of it) rather than to the resource itself (e.g. via its landing page).

properties.name: doi
description: A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) in non-resolving form.
properties.brief: A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) in non-resolving form.
properties.label: doi
schema_notes: The DOI value should not have the resolver URI base, but should have the form 'doi:NNNNN/XXXXXX'
It is expected that this will primarily be Datacite DOIs

properties.name: ediid
description: the NIST EDI identifier assigned to the resource
properties.brief: the NIST EDI identifier assigned to the resource
properties.label: ediid

properties.name: abbrev
description: an abbreviated form of the resource's title
properties.brief: an abbreviated form of the resource's title
properties.label: abbrev
schema_notes: this can be used as a label for a compact display or text for a link to this resource

properties.name: @type
description: the linked-data class types for this resource
properties.brief: the linked-data class types for this resource
properties.label: @type
schema_notes: The value must always be given as an array, even when only one type is provided.
Multiple values indicate that the Resource can be considered of multiple types
If this resource is not to be considered a subtype of the nrd:Resource, its value should be 'nrd:Resource'.

types.name: DataFile
description: a description of a downloadable, finite stream of data
types.brief: a downloadable, finite stream of data

properties.name: filepath
description: a name for the data file reflecting its hierarchical location in the data source collection
properties.brief: a name for the data file reflecting its hierarchical location in the data source collection
properties.label: filepath
schema_notes: Forward slashes delimit the hierarchical names in the path
If there are no slashes in this value, this file is assumed to be at the top of the file hierarchy
The base name of this value (i.e. the last field in the path) can be used as the default filename to give to the file if downloaded.
The component title may have the same value.

properties.name: downloadURL
description: URL providing direct access to the downloadable data file.
properties.brief: URL for downloading a data file
properties.label: Download URL

properties.name: mediaType
description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the file's downloadURL
properties.brief: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the file's downloadURL
properties.label: Media Type

properties.name: format
description: A human-readable description of the file format of a distribution
properties.brief: A human-readable description of the file format of a distribution
properties.label: Format

properties.name: describedBy
description: URL to the data dictionary for the distribution found at the downloadURL.

A data dictionary is usually associated with databases or data files that contain data values with specific labels or names. For example, the data values may be stored in a data table file or spreadsheet; each column in the table will have a name indicating what the value is. A data dictionary explains what each name or label means and provide other related information, such as units for the values. A data dictionary can take a variety of format; if the format is standardized in someway, the describedByType will identify the format.
properties.brief: URL to the data dictionary for the file found at the downloadURL
properties.label: Data Dictionary

properties.name: describedByType
description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the file's describedBy URL
properties.brief: The machine-readable file format of the file's describedBy URL
properties.label: Data Dictionary Type

properties.name: checksum
description: a checksum for the file
properties.brief: a checksum for the file
properties.label: Checksum

properties.name: size
description: the size of the file in bytes
properties.brief: the size of the file in bytes
properties.label: size

use.template: as an allowed value type in the {prop} property in the {type} type

inheritedProperties.brief: a description of a component of a resource

properties.name: @id
description: a (relative) identifier for the distribution
properties.brief: a (relative) identifier for the distribution
properties.label: @id
schema_notes: Though not required by this schema, providing an identifier for a component is critical for merging information from different sources.
A relative identifier requires that @base be set to the Resource identifier in the @context.

properties.name: @type
description: the types of components that this component can be classified as
properties.brief: the types of components that this component can be classified as
properties.label: @type
schema_notes: the first value should be considered its primary type.  This is usually a subtype of Component.

properties.name: title
description: a descriptive title for the component
properties.brief: a descriptive title for the component
properties.label: title

properties.name: description
description: a description of the nature and contents of the component, including the role it plays as part of the resource
properties.brief: a description of the nature and contents of the component, including the role it plays as part of the resource
properties.label: description

properties.name: topic
description: Identified tags referring to things or concepts that this component addresses or speaks to
properties.brief: Identified tags referring to things or concepts that this component addresses or speaks to
properties.label: topic

properties.name: conformsTo
description: URI used to identify a standardized specification the component conforms to
properties.brief: URI used to identify a standardized specification the component conforms to
properties.label: Standard

types.name: Checksum
description: a checksum with its algorithm noted
types.brief: a checksum with its algorithm noted

properties.name: algorithm
description: the algorithm used to produce the checksum hash
properties.brief: the algorithm used to produce the checksum hash
properties.label: algorithm

properties.name: hash
description: the checksum value
properties.brief: the checksum value
properties.label: hash

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type

types.name: Subcollection
description: A grouping of components within a named subcollection of the resource
types.brief: A grouping of components within a named subcollection of the resource

properties.name: filepath
description: a name for the data file reflecting its hierarchical location in the data source collection
properties.brief: a name for the data file reflecting its hierarchical location in the data source collection
properties.label: filepath
schema_notes: Forward slashes delimit the hierarchical names in the path
If there are no slashes in this value, this file is assumed to be at the top of the file hierarchy
The base name of this value (i.e. the last field in the path) can be used as the default filename to give to the file if downloaded.
The component title may have the same value.

properties.name: contains
description: a listing of resource components that are directly part of this subcollection
properties.brief: a listing of resource components that are directly part of this subcollection
properties.label: contains
schema_notes: Each item is a URI identifier (possibly abbreviated)

properties.name: hasParent
description: The identifier for the parent collection that contains this subcollection
properties.brief: The identifier for the parent collection that contains this subcollection
properties.label: hasParent

use.template: as an allowed value type in the {prop} property in the {type} type

types.name: API
description: an application programming interface to the resource
types.brief: an application programming interface to the resource

properties.name: accessURL
description: the base URL for accessing the API.
This URL may or may not be resolvable (consult the documentation at the describedBy URL). With some APIs, this base URL will return information for accessing the full capabilities of the service.
properties.brief: the base URL for accessing the API
properties.label: accessURL

properties.name: describedBy
description: URL to a formal description or informal documentation of the API.
properties.brief: URL to a formal or informal description of the API
properties.label: API Description
schema_notes: Use describedByType to help distinguish between formal and informal (i.e. human readable) descriptions.
notes: Use describedByType to help distinguish between formal and informal (i.e. human readable) descriptions: no describedByType value should indicate a human-readable document.

properties.name: describedByType
description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the API's describedBy URL.
properties.brief: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the API's describedBy URL
properties.label: API Descriptions Type
notes: If no value is given for this property, it can be assumed that the document given by the describedBy URL is human-readable documentation for the API.

types.name: Format
description: a description of a file format that a file employs
types.brief: a description of a file format that a file employs

properties.name: description
description: a human-readable description of the format
properties.brief: a human-readable description of the format
properties.label: description

properties.name: scheme
description: a URI that identifies the format type registry or identification system that the value is defined in.
properties.brief: a URI that identifies the format type registry or identification system that the value is defined in.
properties.label: scheme

properties.name: @id
description: the unique identifier for the format
properties.brief: the unique identifier for the format
properties.label: @id

properties.name: tag
description: a short, display-able token or abbreviation for the format
properties.brief: a short, display-able token or abbreviation for the format
properties.label: tag
schema_notes: As a token, it is intended that applications can search for this value and find all files having the same format.  Thus, regardless of whether the @id field is provided, all references to the same format should use the same tag value.

types.name: DataPublication
description: Data presented by one or more authors as citable publication
types.brief: Data presented by one or more authors as citable publication

properties.name: subtitle
description: a secondary or sub-title for the resource
properties.brief: a secondary or sub-title for the resource
properties.label: subtitle

properties.name: aka
description: other (unofficial) titles that this resource is sometimes known as
properties.brief: other (unofficial) titles that this resource is sometimes known as
properties.label: aka

properties.name: authors
description: the ordered list of authors of this data publication
properties.brief: the ordered list of authors of this data publication
properties.label: authors
schema_notes: Authors should generally be assumed to be considered creators of the data; where this is is not true or insufficient, the contributors property can be used ot add or clarify who contributed to data creation.

properties.name: recommendedCitation
description: a recommended formatting of a citation to this data publication
properties.brief: a recommended formatting of a citation to this data publication
properties.label: recommendedCitation

properties.brief: Main thematic category of the dataset.
properties.label: Category
schema_notes: Could include ISO Topic Categories (http://www.isotopicmaps.org/)

properties.name: @id
description: A (primary) unique identifier for the resource
properties.brief: A (primary) unique identifier for the resource
properties.label: @id
schema_notes: It is expected that this field will contain a type of identifier that is of a uniform type across all resource descriptions in the system
This identifier should, by default, resolve to the metadata record (or some rendering of it) rather than to the resource itself (e.g. via its landing page).

properties.name: doi
description: A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) in non-resolving form.
properties.brief: A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) in non-resolving form.
properties.label: doi
schema_notes: The DOI value should not have the resolver URI base, but should have the form 'doi:NNNNN/XXXXXX'
It is expected that this will primarily be Datacite DOIs

properties.name: ediid
description: the NIST EDI identifier assigned to the resource
properties.brief: the NIST EDI identifier assigned to the resource
properties.label: ediid

properties.name: abbrev
description: an abbreviated form of the resource's title
properties.brief: an abbreviated form of the resource's title
properties.label: abbrev
schema_notes: this can be used as a label for a compact display or text for a link to this resource

properties.name: @type
description: the linked-data class types for this resource
properties.brief: the linked-data class types for this resource
properties.label: @type
schema_notes: The value must always be given as an array, even when only one type is provided.
Multiple values indicate that the Resource can be considered of multiple types
If this resource is not to be considered a subtype of the nrd:Resource, its value should be 'nrd:Resource'.

inheritedProperties.brief: a resource that can/should have a record in NIST's public data listing (PDL)

properties.name: accrualPeriodicity
description: Frequency with which dataset is published.
properties.brief: Frequency with which dataset is published.
properties.label: Frequency

properties.name: bureauCode
description: an identifier provided by the OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C that identifies the originating federal agency
properties.brief: an identifier provided by the OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C that identifies the originating federal agency
properties.label: Bureau Code
schema_notes: OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C is available via http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/omb/assets/a11_current_year/app_c.pdf
A machine-readable listing of the defined codes is available via https://project-open-data.cio.gov/data/omb_bureau_codes.csv
Codes have the format of 015:01

properties.name: programCode
description: an identifier provided by the Federal Program Inventory that identifies the primary program related to this data asset
properties.brief: an identifier provided by the Federal Program Inventory that identifies the primary program related to this data asset
properties.label: Program Code
schema_notes: A machine-readable listing of the defined codes is available via https://www.performance.gov/sites/default/files/files/FederalProgramInventory_FY13_MachineReadable_091613.xls
Codes have the format of 015:001

properties.name: dataQuality
description: Whether the dataset meets the agency's Information Quality Guidelines
properties.brief: Whether the dataset meets the agency's Information Quality Guidelines
properties.label: Data Quality

properties.name: primaryITInvestmentUII
description: The IT Unique Investment Identifier (UII) that is associated with this dataset
properties.brief: The IT Unique Investment Identifier (UII) that is associated with this dataset
properties.label: Primary IT Investment UII

properties.name: systemOfRecords
description: The URL to the System of Records Notice related to this dataset if is so designated under the Privacy Act of 1974
properties.brief: The URL to the System of Records Notice related to this dataset if is so designated under the Privacy Act of 1974
properties.label: System of Records

types.name: Person
description: an identification a Person contributing to the publication of a resource
types.brief: an identification a Person contributing to the publication of a resource

properties.name: @type
description: the class indicating that this is a Person
properties.brief: the class indicating that this is a Person
properties.label: @type

properties.name: fn
description: the author's full name in the preferred format
properties.brief: the author's full name in the preferred format
properties.label: fn

properties.name: givenName
description: the author's given name
properties.brief: the author's given name
properties.label: givenName
schema_notes: Often referred to in English-speaking conventions as the first name

properties.name: familyName
description: the author's family name
properties.brief: the author's family name
properties.label: familyName
schema_notes: Often referred to in English-speaking conventions as the last name

properties.name: middleName
description: the author's middle names or initials
properties.brief: the author's middle names or initials
properties.label: middleName
schema_notes: Often referred to in English-speaking conventions as the first name

properties.name: orcid
description: the author's ORCID
properties.brief: the author's ORCID
properties.label: orcid

properties.name: affiliation
description: The institution the person was affiliated with at the time of publication
properties.brief: The institution the person was affiliated with at the time of publication
properties.label: affiliation

properties.name: proxyFor
description: a local identifier representing this person
properties.brief: a local identifier representing this person
properties.label: proxyFor
schema_notes: This identifier is expected to point to an up-to-date description of the person as known to the local system.  The properties associated with that identifier may be different those given in the current record.

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} list property of the {type} type

types.name: ORCIDpath
description: the format of the path portion of an ORCID identifier (i.e. without the preceding resolver URL base)
types.brief: the format of the path portion of an ORCID identifier (i.e. without the preceding resolver URL base)

use.template: as a value type for the {prop} property in the {type} type
